      • addWindow

        public IWindow addWindow(IWindow p)
                  throws SingletonDialogAlreadyShownException
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager

        Creates a new frame with the provided contents, and shows this new window. The new frame's properties are set according to the WindowInfo object from IWindow's getWindowInfo() method. The new frame is disposed when closed.

        If the provided IWindow also implements SingletonWindow, and another SingletonWindow already exists and uses the same model, this later window will be sent to the foreground and no new window will be created.

        Specified by:
        addWindow in interface MDIManager
        Parameters:
        p - Panel with the contents of the new window.
        Returns:
        Returns the added IWindow, or in case it is a SingletonWindow and there is another SingletonWindow with the same model that it is already shown, returns this later SingletonWindow.
        Throws:
        SingletonDialogAlreadyShownException

      • getSingletonWindow

        public SingletonWindow getSingletonWindow(java.lang.Class windowClass,
                                          java.lang.Object model)
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager
        Return the window associated to the SingletonWindow class and the model specified. If not exists any singleton window associated to this null is returned.
        Specified by:
        getSingletonWindow in interface MDIManager
        Returns:
        the requested window or null.

      • addCentredWindow

        public IWindow addCentredWindow(IWindow p)
                         throws SingletonDialogAlreadyShownException
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager

        Creates a new frame with the provided contents, and shows this new window. The new frame will be centered, regardless the position specified in the WindowInfo object from IWindow's getWindowInfo() method. The new frame is disposed when closed.

        If the provided IWindow also implements SingletonWindow, and another SingletonWindow already exists and uses the same model, this later window will be sent to the foreground and no new window will be created.

        Specified by:
        addCentredWindow in interface MDIManager
        Parameters:
        p - Panel with the contents of the new window.
        Returns:
        Returns the added IWindow, or in case it is a SingletonWindow and there is another SingletonWindow with the same model that it is already shown, returns this later SingletonWindow.
        Throws:
        SingletonDialogAlreadyShownException

        public void centreFrame(IWindow panel)
        Centres the Frame in the contentPane of the MainFrame. If the frame can't be showed completely, it tries to show its top-left corner.
        Parameters:

      • getActiveWindow

        public IWindow getActiveWindow()
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager

        Returns the currently active window, excluding the modal windows and the PALETTE windows. If the currently active window is modal or PALETTE type, the previous non-modal and non-PALETTE active window is returned.

        Modal windows and PALETTE windows are considered to be auxiliary windows, that is the reason why they are not returned.

        Specified by:
        getActiveWindow in interface MDIManager
        Returns:
        A reference to the active window, or null if there is no active window

      • getFocusWindow

        public IWindow getFocusWindow()
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager

        Returns the currently focused window, excluding the modal windows. If the currently focused window is modal, the previous non-modal focused window is returned.

        Specified by:
        getFocusWindow in interface MDIManager
        Returns:
        A reference to the focused window, or null if there is no focused window

      • closeWindow

        public void closeWindow(IWindow p)
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager
        Close the provided window. If the window is openend with the WindowManager, use setVisible(false) in the JPanel to close it.
        Specified by:
        closeWindow in interface MDIManager
        Parameters:
        p - window to be closed

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: IExtension
        This method is invoked by Andami to check whether the extension (and its associated controls) is enabled or disabled. Disabled controls (menus and buttons) are shown in light grey colour, and it is not possible to click on them.
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface IExtension
        Returns:
        true if the extension should be enabled, false otherwise

        Specified by:
        isVisible in interface IExtension
        Returns:
        true if the extension should be visible, false otherwise

                                    java.lang.Object model)
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager

        Specified by:

      • getAllWindows

        public IWindow[] getAllWindows()
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager
        Gets all the open windows. Minimized and maximized windows are included. The application's main frame is excluded; it can be accessed using PluginServices.getMainFrame().
        Specified by:
        getAllWindows in interface MDIManager
        Returns:
        An IWindow array containing all the open windows.

      • getOrderedWindows

        public IWindow[] getOrderedWindows()
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager
        Gets all the open windows (as MDIManager.getAllWindows()), but in this method the windows are returned in the same deepness order that they have in the application.
        Specified by:
        getOrderedWindows in interface MDIManager
        Returns:
        An ordered array containing all the panels in the application. The first element of the array is the topmost (foreground) window in the application. The last element is the bottom (background) window.

                       boolean bMaximum)
                throws java.beans.PropertyVetoException
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager
        Maximizes or restores the provided window
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        v - The window to be maximized or restored
        bMaximum - If true, the window will be maximized, if false, it will be restored

      • setBackgroundImage

        public void setBackgroundImage(javax.swing.ImageIcon image,
                               java.lang.String typeDesktop)
        Description copied from interface: MDIManager
        Sets the provided image as background image in the main window. The image will be centered, set in mosaic or expanded to fill the full window, depending on the typeDesktop argument.
        Specified by:
        setBackgroundImage in interface MDIManager
        Parameters:
        image - The image to be set as background image
        typeDesktop - Decides whether the image should be centered, set in mosaic or expanded. Accepted values are: Theme.CENTERED, Theme.MOSAIC and Theme.EXPAND.

        Specified by:
        showWindow in interface MDIManager
        Parameters:
